intro: Schultesia guianensis var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf schultesia, is a species native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family, characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are often palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. This species is of interest to botanists and ecologists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
